{{Day}} [[Apsis|Perihelion]], the point in the year when the [[Earth]] is closest to the [[Sun]], occurs around this date.

==Events==
*[[1431]] &ndash; [[Joan of Arc]] is defeated by [[Roman Catholic Diocese of Beauvais|Bishop]] [[Pierre Cauchon]].
*[[1521]] &ndash; [[Pope Leo X]] excommunicates [[Martin Luther]] in the [[papal bull]] ''[[Decet Romanum Pontificem]]''.
*[[1653]] &ndash; By the [[Coonan Cross Oath]], the [[Eastern Christianity|Eastern Church]] in [[India]] cuts itself off from colonial [[Portugal|Portuguese]] tutelage.
*[[1749]] &ndash; [[Benning Wentworth]] issues the first of the [[New Hampshire Grants]], leading to the establishment of [[Vermont]].
*  1749   &ndash; The first issue of ''[[Berlingske]]'', [[Denmark]]'s oldest continually operating newspaper, is published.
*[[1777]] &ndash; [[United States|American]] [[General (United States)|General]] [[George Washington]] defeats [[Kingdom of Great Britain|British]] [[General (United Kingdom)|General]] [[Charles Cornwallis, 1st Marquess Cornwallis|Lord Cornwallis]] at the [[Battle of Princeton]].
*[[1815]] &ndash; [[Austria]], the [[United Kingdom]], and [[France]] form a secret defensive alliance against [[Prussia]] and [[Russia]].
*[[1823]] &ndash; [[Stephen F. Austin]] receives a grant of land in [[Texas]] from the government of [[Mexico]].
*[[1848]] &ndash; [[Joseph Jenkins Roberts]] is sworn in as the first [[President of Liberia|president]] of the independent [[Africa]]n [[Liberia]].
*[[1861]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[Delaware]] votes not to secede from the United States.
*[[1868]] &ndash; [[Meiji Restoration]] in [[Japan]]: The [[Tokugawa shogunate]] is abolished; agents of Satsuma and Chōshū seize power.
*[[1870]] &ndash; Construction of the [[Brooklyn Bridge]] begins.
*[[1885]] &ndash; [[Sino-French War]]: Beginning of the [[Battle of Núi Bop]]
*[[1888]] &ndash; The [[refracting telescope]] at the [[Lick Observatory]], measuring 91&nbsp;cm in diameter, is used for the first time. It was the largest [[telescope]] in the world at the time.
*[[1911]] &ndash; A [[1911 Kebin earthquake|magnitude 7.7 earthquake]] destroys the city of [[Almaty]] in [[Russian Turkestan]].
*[[1919]] &ndash; At the [[Paris Peace Conference, 1919|Paris Peace Conference]], Emir [[Faisal I of Iraq]] signs [[Faisal–Weizmann Agreement|an agreement]] with [[Zionism|Zionist]] leader [[Chaim Weizmann]] on the development of a Jewish homeland in [[Palestine]] and an Arab nation in a large part of the Middle East.
*[[1925]] &ndash; [[Benito Mussolini]] announces he is taking dictatorial powers over [[Italy]].
*[[1932]] &ndash; [[Martial law]] is declared in [[Honduras]] to stop a revolt by banana workers fired by the [[United Fruit Company]].
*[[1933]] &ndash; [[Minnie D. Craig]] becomes the first female elected as [[List of Speakers of the North Dakota House of Representatives|Speaker of the North Dakota House of Representatives]], the first female to hold a [[Speaker (politics)|Speaker]] position anywhere in the United States.
*[[1938]] &ndash; The [[March of Dimes]] is established by [[President of the United States|President]] [[Franklin D. Roosevelt]].
*[[1944]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: Top Ace Major [[Pappy Boyington|Greg "Pappy" Boyington]] is shot down in his [[Vought F4U Corsair]] by Captain [[List of World War II aces from Japan|Masajiro Kawato]] flying a [[Mitsubishi A6M Zero]].
*[[1945]] &ndash; World War II: Admiral [[Chester W. Nimitz]] is placed in command of all [[United States Navy|U.S. Naval forces]] in preparation for planned assaults against [[Iwo Jima]] and [[Okinawa Prefecture|Okinawa]] in [[Japan]].
*[[1946]] &ndash; Popular [[Canadian American]] [[jockey]] [[George Woolf]] dies in a freak accident during a race; the annual [[George Woolf Memorial Jockey Award]] is created to honor him.
*[[1947]] &ndash; Proceedings of the [[United States Congress|U.S. Congress]] are televised for the first time.
*[[1949]] &ndash; The [[Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas]], the [[central bank]] of the [[Philippines]], is established.
*[[1953]] &ndash; [[Frances P. Bolton]] and her son, [[Oliver P. Bolton|Oliver]] from [[Ohio]], become the first mother and son to serve simultaneously in the U.S. Congress.
*[[1956]] &ndash; A fire damages the top part of the [[Eiffel Tower]].
*[[1957]] &ndash; The [[Hamilton Watch Company]] introduces the first electric [[watch]].
*[[1958]] &ndash; The [[West Indies Federation]] is formed.
*[[1959]] &ndash; [[Alaska]] is admitted as the 49th [[U.S. state]].
*  1959   &ndash; Separatists in the [[Maldives]] declare the establishment of the [[United Suvadive Republic]].
*[[1961]] &ndash; The United States severs diplomatic relations with [[Cuba]] over the latter's nationalization of American assets.
*  1961   &ndash; A core explosion and meltdown at the [[SL-1]], a government-run reactor near [[Idaho Falls, Idaho]], kills three workers.
*  1961   &ndash; In [[Finland]]'s worst civilian aviation accident an [[Aero Flight 311]] crashes near [[Kvevlax]], resulting in the deaths of all 25 people aboard.
*[[1962]] &ndash; [[Pope John XXIII]] excommunicates [[Fidel Castro]].
*[[1976]] &ndash; The [[International Covenant on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights]] comes into effect.
*[[1977]] &ndash; [[Apple Inc.|Apple Computer]] is incorporated.
*[[1990]] &ndash; Former leader of [[Panama]] [[Manuel Noriega]] surrenders to American forces.
*[[1993]] &ndash; In [[Moscow]], [[Russia]], [[George H. W. Bush|George Bush]] and [[Boris Yeltsin]] sign the second [[START II|Strategic Arms Reduction Treaty]] (START).
*  1994   &ndash; More than seven million people from the former [[Apartheid in South Africa|Apartheid]] [[Bantustan|Homelands]], receive [[South Africa]]n citizenship.
*[[1996]] &ndash; The [[Motorola StarTAC]], the first [[Flip (form)|flip phone]] and one of the first [[mobile phone]]s to gain widespread consumer adoption, goes on sale.
*[[1997]] &ndash; [[China]] announces it will spend [[United States dollar|US$]]27.7 billion to fight [[erosion]] and [[pollution]] in the [[Yangtze River|Yangtze]] and [[Yellow River]] valleys.
*[[1999]] &ndash; The ''[[Mars Polar Lander]]'' is launched.
*  1999   &ndash; [[Israel]] detains, and later expels, 14 members of [[Concerned Christians]].
*[[2000]] &ndash; The last original weekday ''[[Peanuts]]'' [[comic strip]] is published.
*[[2002]] &ndash; Israeli forces seize the Palestinian freighter ''[[Karine A Affair|Karine A]]'' in the [[Red Sea]], finding 50 tons of weapons.
*[[2004]] &ndash; [[Flash Airlines Flight 604]] crashes into the [[Red Sea]], resulting in 148 deaths, making it the deadliest aviation accident in [[Egypt]]ian history.
*[[2009]] &ndash; The first block of the blockchain of the decentralized [[payment system]] [[Bitcoin]], called the ''Genesis block'', was established by the creator of the system, [[Satoshi Nakamoto]].
